Section 1.title: Introduction to Quantum Theory
Section 1.description: This section introduces the basic concepts of quantum theory, explaining what it is and why it is fundamental to our understanding of the physical universe.

Section 2.title: Historical Context of Quantum Mechanics
Section 2.description: In this section, we will explore the historical development of quantum mechanics, highlighting the key experiments and propositions that led to its formulation.

Section 3.title: Key Principles of Quantum Mechanics
Section 3.description: Here, we will delve into the essential principles of quantum mechanics, such as wave-particle duality, superposition, and entanglement, to provide a foundational understanding.

Section 4.title: The Copenhagen Interpretation
Section 4.description: This section will outline the Copenhagen interpretation, detailing its views on measurement and reality, as well as its significance in the development of quantum physics.

Section 5.title: Many-Worlds Interpretation
Section 5.description: We will explore the many-worlds interpretation, discussing its implications for reality and how it contrasts with other interpretations of quantum mechanics.

Section 6.title: Pilot-Wave Theory
Section 6.description: In this section, we will examine the pilot-wave theory, explaining how it attempts to provide a deterministic framework in contrast to the probabilistic nature of other interpretations.

Section 7.title: Philosophical Implications of Quantum Mechanics
Section 7.description: This section will address the broader philosophical questions and implications raised by quantum mechanics, including discussions on reality, observation, and existence.

Section 8.title: Comparative Analysis of Interpretations
Section 8.description: Here, we will compare and contrast the different interpretations discussed, highlighting their strengths, weaknesses, and the debates surrounding them.

Section 9.title: Contemporary Perspectives on Quantum Theory
Section 9.description: This section will present modern viewpoints and ongoing research in quantum mechanics, illustrating how philosophical interpretations continue to evolve.
